intro: Fagara kelekete, commonly known as the "Tropical Beauty" or "Coral Tree," is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, coral-colored bracts that surround its small, white flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Fagara kelekete thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
